evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In early April 2025, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security ("DHS"), through U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement ("ICE"), initiated a sweeping and unprecedented wave of Student and Exchange Visitor Information System ("SEVIS") terminations against hundreds if not thousands of international students with F-1 visas across the country.

extracted.value: In early April 2025, DHS/ICE terminated SEVIS records of hundreds of international students.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiff Zhuoer Chen is a student of the Master of Architecture program at the University of California, Berkeley and will graduate next month. Plaintiff Mengcheng Yu is a master’s student in the Educational Technology and Applied Learning Sciences program at Carnegie Mellon University ("CMU"), and currently resides in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Plaintiff Jiarong Ouyang is a Chinese national. He is a doctoral candidate in Statistics at the University of Cincinnati, and lawfully resides in Cincinnati, Ohio, having maintained F‑1 student status through his full‑time enrollment and academic excellence. Plaintiff Gexi Guo is a Chinese national who earned a Master of Science in Applied Analytics from Columbia University in December 2022, and currently resides in New York City.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs are F‑1 students: Zhuoer Chen (UC Berkeley), Mengcheng Yu (CMU), Jiarong Ouyang (University of Cincinnati), and Gexi Guo (Columbia University).

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Without notice, explanation, or any form of due process, ICE terminated the student status of individuals who have done nothing more than maintaining academic standing and complying with their visa requirements.

extracted.value: Terminations were without notice, explanation, or due process.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs ... have never been convicted of any crime, ... clean academic records, and where applicable, the formal dismissal of any prior legal issues.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs had no criminal record, clean academic records, and no prior legal issues.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: These terminations were arbitrary, capricious, and contrary to law ... violates the Administrative Procedure Act ("APA"), the Fifth Amendment and the Equal Protection Clause to the U.S. Constitution.

extracted.value: Terminations were arbitrary and capricious, violating the APA, Fifth Amendment, and Equal Protection.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In a closely related case, Liu v. DHS, No. 1:25-cv-00133-LM (D.N.H. Apr 7, 2025), where the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire granted a Temporary Restraining Order...

extracted.value: Similar case Liu v. DHS granted a temporary restraining order.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: on or about April 8, 2025, Ms. Chen received notice that her SEVIS record was terminated by DHS, with no prior warning or opportunity to contest the decision.

extracted.value: Ms. Chen’s SEVIS record was terminated on or about April 8, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Her SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025 without any stated legal basis.

extracted.value: Ms. Yu’s SEVIS record was terminated in April 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: His SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025.

extracted.value: Mr. Ouyang’s SEVIS record was terminated in April 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: his SEVIS record was terminated without notice or an opportunity to be heard, based on conduct that has been judicially expunged and is legally deemed not to have occurred.

extracted.value: Mr. Guo’s SEVIS record was terminated in April 2025.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Revocations of Plaintiffs’ visas were done wholesale by other officials, and without satisfying the procedural requirements of Section 1201(i).

extracted.value: Revocation of visas wholesale by other officials without satisfying procedural requirements under Section 1201(i).

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Some have previous contact with law enforcement resulting in dismissed or expunged charges, while others have no record whatsoever.

extracted.value: Some plaintiffs have previous contact with law enforcement resulting in dismissed or expunged charges.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Some have previous contact with law enforcement resulting in dismissed or expunged charges, while others have no record whatsoever.

extracted.value: Some plaintiffs have no record whatsoever.
